item.title: Pj add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "When his life was ruined, his family killed, his farm destroyed, Job knelt down on the ground and yelled up to the heavens, "Why god? Why me?" and the thundering voice of God answered, There's just something about you that pisses me off." -- Stephen King

item.title: Pj add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do one thing every day that scares you." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Pj add a quote by Napoleon Bonaparte
item.description: "Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake." -- Napoleon Bonaparte

item.title: Pj add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I don't know much about being a millionaire, but I'll bet I'd be darling at it." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Pj add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Pj add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Pj add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Pj add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Pj add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Pj add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "You get a little moody sometimes but I think that's because you like to read. People that like to read are always a little fucked up." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: Pj add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Everywhere I go I'm asked if I think the university stifles writers. My opinion is that they don't stifle enough of them. There's many a best-seller that could have been prevented by a good teacher." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Pj add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "If you make a mistake and do not correct it, this is called a mistake." -- Confucius

item.title: Pj add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Pj add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Resist much, obey little." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Pj add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Everyone should be able to do one card trick, tell two jokes, and recite three poems, in case they are ever trapped in an elevator." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Pj add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Pj add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Pj add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Pj add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Pj add a quote by Joseph Joubert
item.description: "The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones." -- Joseph Joubert

item.title: Pj add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Pj add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "My bounty is as boundless as the sea, My love as deep; the more I give to thee, The more I have, for both are infinite." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Pj add a quote by Paul McCartney
item.description: "And, in the end The love you take is equal to the love you make." -- Paul McCartney

item.title: Pj add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "All endings are also beginnings. We just don't know it at the time." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Pj add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To lose one parent may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose both looks like carelessness." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Pj add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "He who controls the past controls the future. He who controls the present controls the past." -- George Orwell

item.title: Pj add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I'm killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Pj add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I've had a perfectly wonderful evening, but this wasn't it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Pj add a quote by Robert Orben
item.description: "Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian." -- Robert Orben

item.title: Pj add a quote by Ann Richards
item.description: "After all, Ginger Rogers did everything that Fred Astaire did. She just did it backwards and in high heels." -- Ann Richards
